text: Emily Borie Hartshorne Mudd (September 6, 1898 – May 2, 1998), was a sexual and marital counselor and birth control advocate. She obtained a master's in social work from the University of Pennsylvania, published paper: A Case Study in Marriage Counseling, the book; The Practice of MARRIAGE COUNSELING (ELMHURST COLLEGE LIBARU) She was a onetime college dropout who trained to be a landscape architect before the trajectory of her life. ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:1898 births Category:1998 deaths Category:American birth control activists Category:The Baldwin School alumni
title: Emily Hartshorne Mudd
